H0.text: An atom is the smallest part of a gold ring that is still gold.

H1.text: An electron is the smallest part of a gold ring that is still gold.

H2.text: A molecule is the smallest part of a gold ring that is still gold.

H3.text: A compound is the smallest part of a gold ring that is still gold.

A4.text: pure gold would be both chemically and isotopically pure, since ordinary gold consists only of one isotope, 197Au

A5.text: The electron configurations of these shells mediate the interaction with neighboring atoms and determine the chemical properties of atoms
